topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/546560a5636872639cb90100#post_546560a5636872639cb90100
That and Amon was wasted as a villain, Mako was the most boring character I've seen in anything ever, the love triangle bullshit was soooooooo forced and grating, and yes Korra was whiny as all fuck. AANG was more mature than she was.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/546561556368720bce440200#post_546561556368720bce440200
Being raised in an isolated compound far from one's peers for the vast majority of one's life does funny things to a person. I won't deny that I found the romance triangle rather irksome as well, though.
topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/546561556368720bce440200#post_546561556368720bce440200
I really liked it. Although I also like season 2 which people seem to think is godawful so maybe I'm not the best judge with this series. 

The love triangle _was_ definitely too forced though
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
Okay, yesterday our Philippine literature professor (who mostly talks to us in English) asked us about our relations with our families. So he asked me which family member am I closest to. You already know the answer to that question. When he asked me to elaborate our relations, I told I'd rather not. Then he says "Please, I insist.". I answered "No, sir. We incest."

Silence then boisterous laughter followed.

Also, Imma take a bath now.
